repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Emergency Horticulture and
            Livestock Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency
            Horticulture and Livestock Project for Afghanistan is to
            assist producer households in adopting improved practices so
            as to increase horticulture and livestock productivity and
            production in focus areas. The restructuring will modify the
            project objective to focus more directly on horticulture and
            livestock productivity, adapt the approach to horticulture
            and livestock development to the local conditions, and
            rationalize the project scope and targets in line with
            available capacity. The project closing date will be
            extended by two years to accommodate the slow start of
            project activities. The revised outcomes will be: (i)
            increase in the productivity and production of horticulture
            and poultry, and (ii) reduced mortality in large and small
            ruminants in the project focus areas.

docna.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Emergency Horticulture and

repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Emergency Horticulture and
            Livestock Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Emergency
            Horticulture and Livestock Project for Afghanistan is to
            stimulate, in focus areas, the marketable output of
            perennial horticulture and livestock enterprises by
            improving the incentive for private investment in the sector
            and by strengthening institutional capacity in agriculture.
            Negative measures include: safety of dams; forests; natural
            habitats; pest management; waste management; and cultural
            property. Mitigation measures include: a) reuse of cut
            material in hill roads; b) safe disposal of wastes; c)
            protection of boundaries from impacts due to construction;
            d) conduct of hydrological investigations during project
            preparation; e) protection of embankment slopes in case of
            alignment on embankments; f) prevent environmental
            degradation as a result of either individual subprojects or
            their cumulative effects; and g) use of pesticide and
            insecticide that may cause harm to natural resources and
            human health.

display_title.display_title:
Afghanistan - Emergency
            Horticulture and Livestock Project : environmental
            assessment : Environment and social safeguards framework
